job_description_formatted:
Our people are customer obsessed. They prioritise the needs and satisfaction of the customer above all else. Our mindset fosters innovation and creates strong, lasting customer relationships as we strive to be the most customer centric company in Australia and New Zealand.

  • Develop trusted relationships with your customers
  • Retain and grow your portfolio whilst leveraging your networks to support small business customers bring their business ideas to life
  • Be part of a collaborative & high performing team

In the role of Small Business Banker, you will join the Small Business Banking team in Newcastlethat’s moving with speed to support our customers.

Each Day, You’ll Go Above And Beyond To

  • Keep things simple whilstmanaging small business lending requests up to $2 million, and home lending up to $5 million
  • Move with speed in this role converting leads into wins, fuelling growth and delivering impressive results whilst driving customer advocacy
  • Be customer obsessed and increase the portion of customers who consider NAB to be their Bank of Choice
  • Own it by understanding our customers’ needs to provide tailored holistic banking solutions.
  • Wintogether by building relationships with our brokers and proprietary customers to create and action new business opportunities as well as supporting our existing customers

We’re looking for the best and brightest to deliver the best for our customers. You’ll need

  • Motivation to build genuine personal connections with our customers, empowering them to feel confident and bring their business dreams to life.
  • Lending experience in business banking or retail banking and navigating credit process
  • Strong customer and relationship management and a passion for networking and growing your portfolio
  • Problem solving, critical thinking and negotiation skills

A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone

We know that our people make us who we are. That's why we have built a culture of equity and respect - where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their authentic selves. job_description_formatted:
• Bring your experience as a Consultant, Penetration Testing to this rewarding role
  • Drive simplification and velocity in delivery through your disciplined execution focus
  • You’ll join a high-performing team, backing talentedindividuals

Our people are customer obsessed. They prioritise the needs and satisfaction of the customer above all else. Our mindset fosters innovation and creates strong, lasting customer relationships as we strive to be the most customer centric company in Australia and New Zealand.

As the Consultant Penetration Testing, you will be part of the Cyber Security team that’s doubling down on customer obsession.

Each Day, You’ll Go Above And Beyond To

  • Provide penetration testing services to a wide range of NAB group products and services, identifying security weaknesses and exposures that pose a risk to the enterprise.
  • Work with project stakeholders to identify assets and define test scopes by evaluating the breadth and depth on which testing should take place based on varying factors.
  • Execute penetration tests, either in a team or individually, to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses that could impact bank systems; including testing of web applications, mobile applications, web APIs, Infrastructure, Cloud technologies, and hardware.
  • Triage vulnerabilities and justify risk in alignment with common vulnerability scoring systems, considering the environment and context.
  • Work with larger technical programs across the bank to understand and construct testing requirements;
  • Assist with other offensive security activities within the team and self-manage security testing projects from end-to-end.

We’re looking for the best and brightest to deliver the best for our customers. You’ll bring:

  • Passion for security and ethical hacking always looking for new tools and techniques to learn about - channelling this passion into penetration testing.
  • Proven experience working in a similar Penetration Tester role, ideally within a large complex organisation
  • Collaborative approach - enjoy working in a team of like-minded professionals, always looking to work with, learn from, and share knowledge to those around you.
  • Understanding of the importance of clearly communicating vulnerabilities and their potential impacts - utilising your written and verbal communication skills to excel at this.
  • Experience testing various technologies and platforms, including but not limited to; Web applications, web APIs, mobile applications (iOS, Android), network and server technologies, cloud services (AWS, Azure), and hardware;
  • Experience writing and conveying complex security findings through reports;
  • Undergraduate (minimum) in technical degree (Computer Science, Software Engineer, Cyber Security)
  • Standard Industry certifications such as OSCP, CREST (CRT, CCT) or equivalent.

job_description_formatted:
Senior Analyst Customer Remediation

Exciting 12 months secondment role for a Senior Analyst Customer Remediation to be a key contributor in a high-performance analytics team, working collaboratively within cross-functional Remediation squads to support the timely resolution of events across the Enterprise!

  • Contribute towards the Remediation Analytics capability at NAB
  • Be involved in delivering initiatives that uplift the consistency and performance of the team
  • 12 months Fixed Term role!

Our people are customer obsessed. They prioritise the needs and satisfaction of the customer above all else. Our mindset fosters innovation and creates strong, lasting customer relationships as we strive to be the most customer centric company in Australia and New Zealand.

In this Senior Analyst Customer Remediation role, you will be joining the Customer Remediation Execution team that’s doubling down on customer obsession and strong deposits growth.

Each day, you’ll go above and beyond to:

  • Support the timely analysis and remediation of customer events by
    • Understanding the priority and criticality of events for the Bank, and considering this in your approach with other teams
    • Orchestrating the sourcing of applicable data from NAB’s different data environments and systems to be used for remediation analytics.
    • Highlighting potential technology process and system changes to obtain data.
    • Obtaining data to identify impacted customers and required compensation. o Managing multiple stakeholders; and
    • Ensuring technical analytics resources have the data, tools and context to effectively analyse event data.
  • Develop and maintain important documentation that describes the remediation event and the systems,
  • Risk accountability forms part of all roles, as everyone is responsible for managing risk and compliance.

We’re looking for the best and brightest to deliver the best for our customers. You’ll need:

  • Strong understanding of the end-to-end customer remediation life cycle mandatory
  • Knowledge of core data principles such as Data Science, Engineering, Analysis and Data Modelling. Knowledge of typical data sourcing / ETL requirement gathering, planning, risks, issues, and the presentation, communication and treatment of these
  • Knowledge of Banking products and financial calculations (e.g. mortgage amortisation, interest, fees and refunds)
  • Understanding of White Label business mandatory
  • 10+ years of Data analysis experience in a technology and data domain.
  • Extensive hands-on experience in SQL in traditional DBMS and/or Cloud. Python knowledge is good to have.

A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone

We know that our people make us who we are. That's why we have built a culture of equity and respect – where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their authentic selves. In partnership with our multiple Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) we continue to foster an inclusive environment, where all NAB colleagues’ unique backgrounds and identities are understood, respected and celebrated. job_title: Associate/Senior Associate - Banks & Insurance - Client Coverage (Northern Hemisphere)
job_location: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
job_summary: Join a high-performing team driving strategic growth and client excellence across UK, Europe, and North America. We're seeking talented, proactive individuals to support our Relationship Managers in expanding our footprint with NAB's Bank and Insurance clients and delivering world-class account leadership. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in deepening client relationships and enabling our teams to focus on strategic growth. The position requires the ability to coordinate cross‑functional stakeholders across time zones, and help identify and convert client interactions into opportunities, while owning repeatable regulatory, data and process workflow - all delivered in line with cross‑border and regulatory requirements. This role offers the successful candidate an opportunity to develop his or her sectoral knowledge, develop client relationship management skills, and to play a key role in driving superior client outcomes. Capabilities, Experience & Qualification Requirements: Essential capabilities Detail‑driven, proactive, and independent executor (able to manage tasks without handholding). Knowledge of correspondent banking and/or insurance sector products/processes (both preferred). Strong prioritisation and time management skills. Ability to coordinate stakeholders across time zones. Sound written and verbal communication + interpersonal skills. Proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel. Desirable capabilities Familiarity with AI tools (e.g., Copilot, ChatGPT). Experience 3-6 years in banking, ideally with KYC, correspondent banking and/or insurance sectoral exposure. Role(s) that demonstrate multi‑stakeholder coordination and process ownership. Qualification requirements Tertiary qualification with a Degree in Business or Finance Key Accountabilities / Decisions: Maintain client Strategic Account Plans, Executive Briefings and contact maps Support origination of new business including high value lending or markets products suitable for the insurance and banking sectors Capture actions from weekly WIP, monthly product/network calls Contribute to the implementation of FGT Global Banks and Insurance teams' strategic initiatives and objectives. Key Responsibilities Coverage (Banks & Insurance) Contribute to Client Coverage Goals Strategic Account Planning, including contact mapping, gap identification and the capturing of opportunities. Pitch materials: Prepare pitchbooks aligned to NAB capabilities and cross‑border rules. Assist with DD requirements; plus onboarding/offboarding: Coordinate documentation and approvals. Event briefings: Prepare materials for major industry events (e.g., Sibos, IMF). Cross‑product coordination (including Deposits, Markets, Trade and DCM business) Meetings and CRM execution: attend meetings, scribe actions, upload to Client Centre, chase follow‑ups. AUD Clearing / Correspondent Banking (Banks only) Correspondent banking due‑diligence: Compile responses with CBDD/FCO, track queries and support RM reviews. Vostro account servicing: Pricing checks (and execution), fee waivers, account opening. Service reviews & analytics: STP/NPP analysis with recommendations; partner on improvements. Key Interfaces Internal Banks & Insurance RMs in London & New York (x4) Client Management & Execution (CME) CDD NH/FCO/CBDD (Correspondent Banking DD) and Transaction Monitoring Markets (FICC/Sales), Corporate Finance, Credit, Legal, Treasury, Client Centre team London, Paris & NY leadership External Clients in Europe & North America, under RM direction Key Performance Indicators Diligently meet deadlines with high quality results. Effective portfolio management, inclusive of maintaining hygiene and deliver result within expected timelines. Contribution to FGT Insurance and Banks client coverage in achieving its financial and strategic objectives, including simplification and productivity gains. Engagement and relationship with Key Interfaces as measured by feedback from those groups It's more than a career at NAB. It's about more opportunity, more moments to make a difference and more focus on you. Your job is just one part of your life. When you bring your ideas, energy, and hunger for growth to us, you'll be recognised and rewarded for your contribution in return. You'll have our support to excel for our customers, deliver positive change for our communities and grow your career. It's a good time to see what more you can find at NAB as an Associate / Senior Associate - Banks & Insurance - Client Coverage (Northern Hemisphere) A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone. At NAB, we're intent on building a culture we can all be proud of. One based on trust and respect. An uplifting environment where every single one of us feels appreciated and empowered to be our true, authentic selves. A diverse and inclusive workplace where our differences are celebrated, and our contributions are valued. It's a huge part of what makes NAB such a special place to be. Join NAB If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. To be eligible to apply, you must have UK citizenship or UK working rights. job_description_formatted:
Join a high-performing team driving strategic growth and client excellence across UK, Europe, and North America.

We're seeking talented, proactive individuals to support our Relationship Managers in expanding our footprint with NAB's Bank and Insurance clients and delivering world-class account leadership. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in deepening client relationships and enabling our teams to focus on strategic growth.

The position requires the ability to coordinate cross‑functional stakeholders across time zones, and help identify and convert client interactions into opportunities, while owning repeatable regulatory, data and process workflow - all delivered in line with cross‑border and regulatory requirements.

This role offers the successful candidate an opportunity to develop his or her sectoral knowledge, develop client relationship management skills, and to play a key role in driving superior client outcomes.

Capabilities, Experience & Qualification Requirements:

Essential capabilities

  • Detail‑driven, proactive, and independent executor (able to manage tasks without handholding).
  • Knowledge of correspondent banking and/or insurance sector products/processes (both preferred).
  • Strong prioritisation and time management skills.
  • Ability to coordinate stakeholders across time zones.
  • Sound written and verbal communication + interpersonal skills.
  • Proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel.

Desirable capabilities

  • Familiarity with AI tools (e.g., Copilot, ChatGPT).

Experience

  • 3-6 years in banking, ideally with KYC, correspondent banking and/or insurance sectoral exposure.
  • Role(s) that demonstrate multi‑stakeholder coordination and process ownership.

Qualification requirements

  • Tertiary qualification with a Degree in Business or Finance

Key Accountabilities / Decisions:

  • Maintain client Strategic Account Plans, Executive Briefings and contact maps
  • Support origination of new business including high value lending or markets products suitable for the insurance and banking sectors
  • Capture actions from weekly WIP, monthly product/network calls
  • Contribute to the implementation of FGT Global Banks and Insurance teams' strategic initiatives and objectives.

Key Responsibilities

Coverage (Banks & Insurance)

  • Contribute to Client Coverage Goals
  • Strategic Account Planning, including contact mapping, gap identification and the capturing of opportunities.
  • Pitch materials: Prepare pitchbooks aligned to NAB capabilities and cross‑border rules.
  • Assist with DD requirements; plus onboarding/offboarding: Coordinate documentation and approvals.
  • Event briefings: Prepare materials for major industry events (e.g., Sibos, IMF).
  • Cross‑product coordination (including Deposits, Markets, Trade and DCM business)
  • Meetings and CRM execution: attend meetings, scribe actions, upload to Client Centre, chase follow‑ups.

AUD Clearing / Correspondent Banking (Banks only)

  • Correspondent banking due‑diligence: Compile responses with CBDD/FCO, track queries and support RM reviews.
  • Vostro account servicing: Pricing checks (and execution), fee waivers, account opening.

In this role, you will

As a Customer Advisor, you will act as the face of NAB to the community, working closely with our customers to help them with their banking needs and deliver exceptional customer service in an environment that is challenging and fast-paced.

Supporting our Chinchilla and surrounding branches, you will be the first point of contact for customers when they visit our retail branch, whether it’s to open an account, inquire about our products, or manage their finances. You’ll be involved in every aspect of the customer journey by helping them find solutions to their financial needs through our products, services, and advice. A big aspect of the Customer Advisor role currently is the focus on protecting our customers from scams and online phishing.

Every day is different in our NAB branches and as well as providing great customer service, you will have the opportunity to gain leadership skills, develop your career path within NAB and work in a diverse and supportive team environment.

If you are interested in a career in financial services, starting as Customer Service Advisor is the first step of many towards several career pathways at NAB.

The hours:

The role's working hours will be 9:00am- 4.30pm Monday to Thursday and 9:00am – 5.15pm on Friday offering the perfect balance between work and life tailored to fit your lifestyle needs.

What you’ll bring:

  • A passion for delivering an amazing experience to customers and an unwavering commitment to quality, with the will to go the extra mile.
  • An ability to work collaboratively as a team and resilience, self-motivation and energy to create our signature customer experience.
  • A keen eye for detail that ensures transactions are completed efficiently and accurately
  • An appreciation for inclusion and the diversity of our customers

More focus on you

All new Customer Advisors receive NAB’s tailored onboarding and training program to ensure they are set up for success. As a reward for your success and passion for helping customers, we offer a multitude of benefits including an attractive base salary and fantastic career-growth opportunities.

job_description_formatted:
• Work on diverse, challenging projects that directly influence strategy and outcomes
  • Collaborate with a supportive, dynamic team that values innovation
  • Grow your technical expertise while shaping the future of data-driven decisions.

Our people are customer obsessed. They prioritise the needs and satisfaction of the customer above all else. Our mindset fosters innovation and creates strong, lasting customer relationships as we strive to be the most customer centric company in Australia and New Zealand.

As a Data Analyst in the Home Ownership Analytics team, you’ll work closely with the Home Ownership product team, who are doubling down on delivering exceptional customer and product outcomes.

Each day, you’ll go above and beyond to:

  • Design, build, prototype, visualise, test and deploy based on business requirements
  • Ensuring all documents are up to date
  • Refresh reports at the agreed SLA, including any data collection for ingestion required for the report refresh
  • Troubleshoot production issues and able to articulate problems to onshore teams for resolution
  • Implement minor changes, test and validate to ensure all data is correct
  • Support and maintenance of ongoing target state data models and dashboard reporting using Power BI

We’re looking for the best and brightest to deliver the best for our customers. You’ll need:

  • Proven experience as a Business Analyst in complex business settings.
  • You will have the ability to analyse data and present it in an effective and meaningful manner.
  • Understand financial services data and able to understand data models and relationships to compile reporting and metrics.
  • Ability to represent data in a graphical or pictorial format based on requirements using NAB’s visualisation tools such as Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau and Power BI.
  • Batchelor degree in business, data analytics/computer science, statistics or related disciplines.

A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone

We know that our people make us who we are. That’s why we have built a culture of equity and respect - where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their authentic selves. job_summary: Prior experience with Loan IQ is a mandatory requirement. The role also requires alignment with EST working hours . Purpose To support the Agency & Trustee Services business (Corporate Finance) in the operational/ middle office management and efficient oversight and execution of bespoke transactions acting as the Facility Agent, Security Trustee, Intercreditor Agent, Escrow Agent, Account Bank, USPP Paying Agent or Note Registry services. Such transactions are originated within Corporate & Institutional Banking and Corporate Finance. To ensure work is dealt with efficiently and accurately, in accordance with transaction documentation, policies and procedures in order to provide Stakeholders/ colleagues and customers with a cost effective and efficient best practice. Key Accountabilities: Work closely to support the Agency Relationship Managers to provide a seamless service to Borrowers and Syndicate Lenders; Monitor, respond to and action all requests received in a timely and professional manner and escalate to Manager and Senior Manager in a timely manner where required; Adhere to processes and procedures pertinent to role including performing all controls associated with processes to minimise errors and rework; Escalate events, issues or breaches as they are identified and encourage team members to do so also (risk accountability forms part of all roles, as everyone is responsible for managing risk and compliance); Administer externally facing website, Debt Domain, throughout the lifecycle of deals; Process Transfer certificates/ Secondary Trading requests; Coordination of AML/KYC on Lenders entering a Syndicated deal via a Secondary Trade, New Deal and any Refinancing's; Monitor Agency PPS mailbox, maintain register and action emails in line with regulatory requirements; Co-ordinate requests to issue, amend or cancel contingent liabilities such as Bank Guarantees and Letters of Credit; Responsible for documentation distribution, storage, recall and maintenance of the security documents register; Co-ordinate requests to set up new, perform amendments or terminate bank accounts and term deposits controlled by Agency and Trustee Services; Co-ordinate minor administration related consent requests on behalf of the Agent; Co-ordinate execution and delivery of original documents including printing multiple copies of documents and arrangement of courier delivery; Completion of New and Terminated facility checklists and completion of the Deal Review process; Attend Stakeholder Meetings where required on behalf of the Agency Services Team Customer: timely resolution of requests/delivery against SLAs with minimal rework and errors People: contribution to engagement activities and team meetings, improved team engagement and increase agility (cross- skilling) between teams. Strong rigor around operational excellence, consistent productivity and good use of diverted time. Strong adherence to risk and controls frameworks to minimise risk events Contribution to deliver process improvements that improve customer service while reducing cost. Required Experience- ~4-7 years experience as a financial services / operational banking practitioner Preferred experience within the Corporate and/or Institutional Bank Loan Market or similar environment of >7 years LoanIQ, SWIFT, RTGS knowledge Essential capabilities Strong Interpersonal skills Strong time management and prioritisation skills An ability to adapt and learn in a fast- paced environment Payments knowledge including Swift, RTGS & EFT payments (preferred) Show more Show less

job_description_formatted:
Prior experience with Loan IQ is a mandatory requirement. The role also requires alignment with EST working hours.


Purpose

To support the Agency & Trustee Services business (Corporate Finance) in the operational/ middle office management and efficient oversight and execution of bespoke transactions acting as the Facility Agent, Security Trustee, Intercreditor Agent, Escrow Agent, Account Bank, USPP Paying Agent or Note Registry services. Such transactions are originated within Corporate & Institutional Banking and Corporate Finance.


To ensure work is dealt with efficiently and accurately, in accordance with transaction documentation, policies and procedures in order to provide Stakeholders/ colleagues and customers with a cost effective and efficient best practice.


Key Accountabilities:

  • Work closely to support the Agency Relationship Managers to provide a seamless service to Borrowers and Syndicate Lenders;
  • Monitor, respond to and action all requests received in a timely and professional manner and escalate to Manager and Senior Manager in a timely manner where required;
  • Adhere to processes and procedures pertinent to role including performing all controls associated with processes to minimise errors and rework;
  • Escalate events, issues or breaches as they are identified and encourage team members to do so also (risk accountability forms part of all roles, as everyone is responsible for managing risk and compliance);
  • Administer externally facing website, Debt Domain, throughout the lifecycle of deals;
  • Process Transfer certificates/ Secondary Trading requests;
  • Coordination of AML/KYC on Lenders entering a Syndicated deal via a Secondary Trade, New Deal and any Refinancing's;
  • Monitor Agency PPS mailbox, maintain register and action emails in line with regulatory requirements;
  • Co-ordinate requests to issue, amend or cancel contingent liabilities such as Bank Guarantees and Letters of Credit;
  • Responsible for documentation distribution, storage, recall and maintenance of the security documents register;
  • Co-ordinate requests to set up new, perform amendments or terminate bank accounts and term deposits controlled by Agency and Trustee Services;
  • Co-ordinate minor administration related consent requests on behalf of the Agent;
  • Co-ordinate execution and delivery of original documents including printing multiple copies of documents and arrangement of courier delivery;
  • Completion of New and Terminated facility checklists and completion of the Deal Review process;
  • Attend Stakeholder Meetings where required on behalf of the Agency Services Team
  • Customer: timely resolution of requests/delivery against SLAs with minimal rework and errors
  • People: contribution to engagement activities and team meetings, improved team engagement and increase agility (cross- skilling) between teams.
  • Strong rigor around operational excellence, consistent productivity and good use of diverted time.
  • Strong adherence to risk and controls frameworks to minimise risk events
  • Contribution to deliver process improvements that improve customer service while reducing cost.


Required Experience-

  • ~4-7 years experience as a financial services / operational banking practitioner
  • Preferred experience within the Corporate and/or Institutional Bank Loan Market or similar environment of >7 years
  • LoanIQ, SWIFT, RTGS knowledge


Essential capabilities

  • Strong Interpersonal skills
  • Strong time management and prioritisation skills
  • An ability to adapt and learn in a fast- paced environment
  • Payments knowledge including Swift, RTGS & EFT payments (preferred)

job_description_formatted:
• Are you passionate about helping Australians achieve their dream of home ownership?
  • Do you thrive in a fast-paced, customer-centric environment where your expertise and dedication can make a real difference to our customers?
  • Are you a high-performing lender ready to grow your network and business?

If so, we invite you apply as a Home Lending Executive. We have number of opportunities available across Australia.

At NAB, we're committed to shaping a brighter future for our customers. As a Home Lending Executive, you'll play a pivotal role in delivering tailored lending solutions to meet the individual needs of our diverse customers.

How We Work

We put customers at the heart of everything we do. This means supporting NAB Lenders to deliver great solutions, every day, through seamless processes and quick systems.

The superheros of NAB, our Propriety Lenders, are fully empowered to drive and grow their own business. With the complete backing of NAB’s Executive Leadership Team, NAB lenders can access internal referrals, partner with branch colleagues, connect with the local community or attend industry events to build their own networks and brand.

What You'll Do:

  • Partner with customers to provide expert advice and guidance on NAB’s home loan possibilities.
  • Manage end-to-end lending processes, ensuring speedy and exceptional service at every touchpoint.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with both new and established clients, working closely to understand their financial goals.
  • Collaborate with a team of dedicated professionals, all driven to provide outstanding results.
  • Leverage innovative technology to streamline processes and improve the customer experience.

What You Will Bring:

  • Proven experience in home lending or demonstrated expertise as a banker seeking a new career or eager to embark on your lending journey.
  • Strong knowledge of lending products and the mortgage industry.
  • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills.
  • A passion for delivering top-notch customer service.
  • The ability to thrive in a dynamic, results-oriented environment.

Why Choose NAB? At NAB, we’re more than just Australia’s largest business bank – we’re a community. You’ll be part of a culture that values diversity, collaboration, and continuous learning. Some other benefits you can expect when you join:

  • Competitive remuneration and access to a multitude of NAB’s employee benefits.
  • Quick processes and market leading lending products to serve customers well.
  • Full backing from NAB’s Executive Leadership team to grow your lending business.
  • Empowerment to connect with other business units across NAB and complete autonomy to expand your customer base and networks.
  • Continuous coaching, training, and career development conversations to help you reach you career goals.
  • A flexible working environment that supports work-life balance.
  • Access to NAB’s wide range of employee benefits, including health and wellbeing programs.

Ready to Make a Difference? If you’re driven by success, passionate about helping people, and ready to take your career to new heights, we’d love to hear from you. Express your interest in becoming a Home Lending Executive at NAB today and help us continue to support Australians on their home ownership journey.

Apply Now to continue building your career and be part of something bigger at NAB.
